intro: Psychotria scortechinii, commonly known as the red-eyed woodshock, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a small, red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Psychotria scortechinii is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
